amine achergui wrote:

> Is there any test pattern to test a recursive method ( in my case,
> the method's body calls  collaborators thus in the test method i use mocks).
> Is there any pattern or recipe to solve this?

So you have a method that wants to invoke itself, and you'd like to mock 
  the call to itself.

In this case, ignore the method being repetitively recursive, because by 
putting a mock in there, you're ensuring that the method will only call 
itself one. (The mock won't invoke itself any more than that.)

As for a method invoking itself, there's no direct way to mock the 
invocation. Some basic reasoning should make that clear: if the method 
is mocked, then it wouldn't invoke itself. :)

I have thought about this in the abstract before, and don't have an 
answer, except to point out that I've never wanted to do this. There 
must be a reason for that, and I hope it's a good one. :)

Can you tell us what this method does? Perhaps that will shed some light 
on what to do.
